entries.content: When a prospect expresses disinterest or skepticism, gently probe the reason behind it to understand their perspective.
If a prospect gives a vague 'no' or pushback, ask clarifying questions like 'You don't like it?' to diagnose the true objection.
Accept the prospect's 'no' for the immediate offer gracefully, but remain open to continuing the conversation to understand their situation or build rapport for future potential.
If a prospect hangs up abruptly, call back immediately and use the phrase 'I think we got cut off' as a soft way to re-engage.
Even after a prospect says they are the 'wrong person' or not a fit, continue asking questions about their business or situation to gain insight.
Maintain a mindset of curiosity; don't be afraid to ask further questions even when the prospect has indicated they are not a potential customer.

focus_area: Handling "Not Interested": Probe softly, diagnose if disinterest or timing
